title: 98 &lrm;&ndash; 98 Degrees And Rising - 320cbr (Big Papi) 1998
description:
Source: 1998 CD 320cbr
-
By Greg

This is a great CD! You have to buy it. I'm usually not into Motown groups, but 98 Degrees is cool. "Invisible Man" really got me hooked onto them and this album is even better than the first. For those of you who associate 98 Degrees with a boy band are definitely mistaken. They are mature and can actually sing (they don't dance, also).
1. Intro - kinda corny but what intro isn't?

2. Heat It Up - this song makes you wanna dance and is a good way to start the CD. I really like it.

3. If She Only Knew - Good slow song. You can feel them, nice harmonies.

4. I Do (Cherish You) - very sweet song. I'd love to play this at my wedding.

5. Fly With Me - I love this song. The part where Jeff Timmons sings a long, high note is beautiful.

6. Still - Nice slow song. This song was written by 98 Degrees and it's very heartfelt.

7. Because Of You - this song will always be a hit. I never get tired of it.

8. Give It Up - this is a nice a cappella song, also written by 98 Degrees, nice harmony

9. Do You Wanna Dance - obviously, you could really dance to this song, you can also hear Drew and Justin who hardly get to sing, I like this song

10. True To Your Heart - this was the first song I hear from this album and I loved it then and I still love, Stevie Wonder sounds good in this one

11. To Me You're Everything - this song has boy band content, but it's still a good song

12. The Hardest Thing - I love this song. It should have gone #1. Loved the video.

13. She's Out Of My Life - This is definitely my all time favorite 98 Degrees song. The harmonies are so beautiful and Jeff sounds really good in this one. You might even cry.
